creator: marnix+sync

title: How can I prevent Firefox from opening PDFs sent as attachments, but keep previewing when inline?
content:
I want to be able to view inline PDFs in the browser, and download PDFs sent as attachments, without opening them in Firefox. I've searched the forum, tried different combinations of download settings and toggling `browser.download.open_pdf_attachments_inline` but no dice, either Firefox downloads every file (inline or attached), or it opens the local file in the browser.

I respect that the PDF viewer in Firefox is great, and I want to keep using it when I choose. Right now, I have a download progress that pops up, then the browser becomes unresponsive and switches to the new tab, which is disrupting.

Seems simple but how can I have the following behaviour? - Inline PDF -> view in browser - Attachment -> download without opening in browser
creator: goulvench

title: jak se zbavit účtu na googlu
content: Jednou jsem se přihlásila na svém počítači na mozille na školní účet mé dcery a od té doby se nastavil jako hlavní a automaticky se, když se chci přihlásit do googlu, objeví přihlašovací stránka školy dcery a já se nemůžu vůbec přihlásit do svého googl účtu, nedokázala jsem to, ani když jsem vymazala přihlašovací údaje dcery z hesel na mozille. Prostě se tam už vůbec nejde dostat. Když zadám accounts.google.com, tak to zase přeskočí na přihlašování přes stránku školy. Je to jak virus... Podpora na googlu mi vůbec nepomohla. Jsem naprosto laický uživatel. Dostat se do správy hesel byl po mě asi tak největší výkon, kterého jsem schopna... Budu ráda za radu polopatě. Děkuji MJ
creator: martinabara

title: Silent uninstall on Windows ( -ms or /S) does not bypass Windows warning
content:
Dear All,

I need to uninstall Firefox silently from several computers, due to company restrictions. Uninstall must be silent (automatic), because I push the uninstall from Microsoft InTune.

At this stage, using "-ms" or "/S", I can bypass the normal uninstaller prompt, but I still get a Windows warning (from User Access Control), asking autorisation to perform changes on the device.

Can I bypass this prompt as well, so that the uninstall is indeed automatic and silent?

Alternatively do you know of means to modify this at Windows level?

Many thanks!
creator: firefox2702

title: non removable items
content: How come when you add some features in firefox updates, they are not removable for me?!? I am talking about the "extensions" tab and the "list all tabs". Some people might want them for their use but I dont. I should have the option to remove them at my leisure. I dont like this at all that I cant make that decision. Please fix. Thank you.

title: webgl videos
content: I worked for a lot of time of some splendid webgl animation on a laptop gbl file in threejs that renders a video on screen texture and it worked fine untill firefox did some updates and videos in laptop screen is glitchy, if i disable hardware acceleration it works, BUT firefox comes with it enabled by default and when clients come into my page see that ugly effect of the video, AND no there is not video drivers problem, my drivers are the latest and i tryed on different devices same thing, i thought that there are some problems with my domain checked and triple checked and no, with an older version of firefox it works perfectly, i tryed looking on other people webgl with video on it to see maybe i have a problem on my code and its same thing, no cors problems, drivers, or how video is coded, i loved firefox im using it for years but now i hate it so much cause it ruined months of work

title: How to hide new tab manager
content:
after the changes in firefox 131 the following pref no longer hides tab manager:

user_pref("browser.tabs.tabmanager.enabled", false);

To further clarify, tab manager is the arrow button (or the new icon in firefox 131) besides the minimize button of your firefox window. I want to hide that.
creator: forkbun

title: Google will no longer take me to sign-in page from Firefox
content:
Hi - after a Firefox update today, I no longer seem to be able to access a sign-in page for any of my Google accounts. When I try to log into Google, I'm just brought to a page that says "clear cache and cookies." I've cleared my cache multiple times, restarted Firefox, run troubleshoot mode, restarted my computer - none of this has helped. Every time I try to go to a page to sign into any Google app - Drive, Gmail, etc. - I get taken to the same "Google Help Center" page telling me to clear cache and cookies. When I click on the "sign in" button in the corner of this page, it just brings me back to the same help page.

My Google accounts aren't the problem because I can access them from Chrome or Safari. But I don't want to use Chrome or Safari!

I've never encountered anything like this before. Help?
creator: gloriabruce00

title: Firefox interaction with Windows Credential Manager
content:
Is it normal that Firefox is trying to load the dll related to the Windows Credential Manager (vaultcli.dll)

"firefox.exe loaded module vaultcli.dll"

If so, what's the purpose of this interaction?

From the looks of it, Firefox is trying to access locally stored credentials using the Credentials Management API.

title: Video and Audio Desync Issues When Utilizing Bluetooth Earbuds
content:
Hello,

I have discovered a reproducible issue pertaining to audio and video desyncing that I have tested on youtube, prime video, and netflix.

I am utilizing Windows 11 Home on an HP Envy Laptop. The bluetooth audio device I am using are the Galaxy Buds FE.

Audio desyncs from video playback when pausing a video (either by clicking pause, using the keyboard to press pause, or by pausing using the earbud touchpad). I noticed that with my desktop computer and my Samsung S22 Ultra phone, when pausing and unpausing a video, the video player has a brief buffering period to auto-sync the audio to the video; however, this is not occurring with the laptop and it causes the audio and video to desync.

Any help you could provide with this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
creator: jameslee1

title: Firefox ver. 131 excess memory usage
content: I am running Firefox ver. 131. The program constantly increases the amount of memory it uses. The program will continue to use more memory until it locks up the system and I have to use Task Manager to restart . I don't know how to solve this. It is a new development which may be associated with the 131 update. Please help.

title: can't sync multiple profiles?
content:
I have what i am sure is a common scenario, a work pc (mac) and home pc (linux), and I want to have a work profile and home profile that are independently synced across those PCs.

It's no problem to setup sync for the work profile but while setting up sync for the home profile it seems firefox doesn't grok that the home profile already exists and treats it like a new mozilla account.

In debugging this issue (and the "Primary account email required for sign-in" issue, which prevented me from signing in at all) i've come across numerous articles that imply this basic home<->home work<->work sync across 2 devices does not work with firefox. Is this the case? this is a basic (IMO mandatory) requirement for a browser in 2024 and even the difficulty of setting this up is super jarring coming from Chrome.
creator: glycoslave
